citations.narrative:
Enclosures are not being cleaned properly. The walls of 7 sheltered primary enclosures housing 23 adult dogs are soiled
with brown material. Inadequate and infrequent cleaning and sanitization allows for the growth of disease-causing agents
that may increase the risk of health hazards for the animals. Appropriate cleaning and sanitization of the surfaces must
include removal of the buildup of material found and to prevent accumulation of this material. All surfaces of housing
facilities must be cleaned and sanitized when necessary to satisfy generally accepted husbandry standards and practices.
Correct by ensuring hard surfaces with which the dogs come into contact with are spot cleaned daily and sanitized in
accordance with 3.11 (b) of this subpart to prevent accumulation of excreta and reduce disease hazards. Correct by 6-
SEPT-2024.

The applicant is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). Six dogs are not
up to date on their Distemper and Parvovirus vaccinations, a required vaccination. The current Program of Veterinary
Care prescribes for these vaccines to be given yearly.
•The following dogs have no history of receiving a Distemper or Parvovirus vaccination:
-Adult female Poodle (#3174), Adult female Poodle (#6892), and Adult male Yorkshire Terrier (#6505).
• The following dogs are overdue for the Distemper and Parvovirus vaccines:
-Adult female Poodle (#6304), Adult female Poodle (#6306), and Adult female Poodle (#6307) last received these
vaccines on 4/29/2023 and were due on 4/29/2024.
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule leaves the dogs susceptible to
Distemper and Parvovirus, which if contracted, can cause pain, distress, and suffering. Correct by ensuring all animals
are vaccinated in accordance with the guidelines and schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian. Correct by 6-
SEPT-2024.

The licensee does not maintain complete medical records for all adult dogs. Records indicate that five dogs have no
vaccination history:
•Adult male Boxer (#7011), Adult female Boxer (#7396), Adult female Boxer (#3188), Adult female Boxer (#5702), Adult
female Boxer (#7251).
The licensee states that the animals are up to date for these vaccines but they did not record that information in the
medical record. Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine
if the animals are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the
names of all vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments
given and ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 30-AUG-2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
3.1(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Enclosures are not being cleaned properly. The walls of 7 sheltered primary enclosures housing 23 adult dogs are soiled 
with brown material. Inadequate and infrequent cleaning and sanitization allows for the growth of disease-causing agents 
that may increase the risk of health hazards for the animals. Appropriate cleaning and sanitization of the surfaces must 
include removal of the buildup of material found and to prevent accumulation of this material. All surfaces of housing 
facilities must be cleaned and sanitized when necessary to satisfy generally accepted husbandry standards and practices. 
Correct by ensuring hard surfaces with which the dogs come into contact with are spot cleaned daily and sanitized in 
accordance with 3.11 (b) of this subpart to prevent accumulation of excreta and reduce disease hazards. Correct by 6-
SEPT-2024. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The applicant is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). Six dogs are not 
up to date on their Distemper and Parvovirus vaccinations, a required vaccination. The current Program of Veterinary 
Care prescribes for these vaccines to be given yearly.  
 
•The following dogs have no history of receiving a Distemper or Parvovirus vaccination: 
 
-Adult female Poodle (#3174), Adult female Poodle (#6892), and Adult male Yorkshire Terrier (#6505). 
 
• The following dogs are overdue for the Distemper and Parvovirus vaccines: 
 
 -Adult female Poodle (#6304), Adult female Poodle (#6306), and Adult female Poodle (#6307) last received these 
vaccines on 4/29/2023 and were due on 4/29/2024. 
 
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule leaves the dogs susceptible to 
Distemper and Parvovirus, which if contracted, can cause pain, distress, and suffering. Correct by ensuring all animals 
are vaccinated in accordance with the guidelines and schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian. Correct by 6-
SEPT-2024.

3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee does not maintain complete medical records for all adult dogs. Records indicate that five dogs have no 
vaccination history: 
 
•Adult male Boxer (#7011), Adult female Boxer (#7396), Adult female Boxer (#3188), Adult female Boxer (#5702), Adult 
female Boxer (#7251). 
 
The licensee states that the animals are up to date for these vaccines but they did not record that information in the 
medical record. Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine 
if the animals are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the 
names of all vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments 
given and ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 30-AUG-2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
